description:
DW.CodedUI - Test your UI fast and easy.

* Its written in .Net 4.0
* Its built to be used every visual studio version no matter if the MS "automated UI" is included or not
* Its developed under the MIT license

This beta is the preview of a version which is planned to work at least in VS 2015 community edition (Kind of stand alone).
Like for all my assemblies, even minor versions are releases, odds are betas like this one.

Actually you should have 2013 installed and set the assembly references like in the versions before. The test project then should run in VS 2015 Community edition.
(See the project templates to download on the project website)
For the final release I planned to bring some project templates online, and also a kind of "configuration utility" which sets all needed references and files according to the current system. VS 2012 installed, Enterprise available, complete stand-alone and so on.

Stand-alone download: http://libs.my-libraries.com/DW.CodedUI/v2.5.0/Assembly.zip
Changelog: http://libs.my-libraries.com/DW.CodedUI/v2.5.0/Changelog.txt
Documentation: http://libs.my-libraries.com/DW.CodedUI/v2.5.0/Documentation


Scenario:
* Visual Studio 2013 Premium is installed (Can be the unlicensed demo! It will never started.)
* Visual Studio 2015 Community Edition should run UI tests.
1. Create a normal unit test project
2. Add reference the DW.CodedUI.dll
3. Add reference to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\Common7\IDE\PrivateAssemblies\Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITest.Logging.dll"
4. Add reference to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\Common7\IDE\PublicAssemblies\UIAComWrapper.dll"
5. Add "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\Common7\IDE\PublicAssemblies\Interop.UIAutomationClient.dll" as existing item 
(reference will not copy the file to the output directory) and set build action to "None" and "Copy Always"
